III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has a cognitive impairment. Sometime this week, youth
shoved staff and staff shoved youth back. Youth did not have any
visible marks or bruises. The owner of the facility told youth not to
tell anyone what happened.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source is from an anonymous source.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 27,
2023. Youth A reported he was in a happy mood because he just
came back from an outing with Staff 1 to get new toys. When
asked if there was ever a disagreement that occurred with Staff 1,
Youth A reported last week Wednesday or Thursday he got into
with Staff 1 and he pushed her. Youth A explained he had taken a
shower, went into his room and then went to get his toys in the
living room. He reported Staff 1 asked him to do something that he
did not want to do, and he decided just to grab his items from the
living room and go to his room. Youth A reported when he was
going back to his room, he pushed passed Staff 1 on purpose and
intentionally pushed his body into her body full force. He reported
this made Staff 1 fall a little bit which made it so she pushed back
onto him. Youth A reported the pushback from Staff 1 was an
accident, but his push was intentional because he was upset. He
reported he did not want to discuss what task Staff 1 was asking
him to do and reported it was all in the past now. Youth A reported
Staff 2 was working when this occurred, and no other youth
witnessed this occurring. He reported Administrator 1 talked to
him the next night after the incident and told him he should not be
pushing staff. Youth A reported Administrator 1 told him not to talk
about the situation with other youth and other staff members
because it was not necessary to involve anyone else in the drama.
Youth A reported he was able to talk with Therapist about it. He
acknowledged he was allowed to talk to any adult about the
situation but not the other youth. Youth A reported he did
2

apologize to Staff 1 for pushing her and he feels safe at the
facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 27,
2023. Staff 1 reported on Wednesday, July 19, 2023, Youth A had
an incident where he pushed her. She explained she had taken
the youth out of the home to run errands and get slushies. When
they were in the van, she reported to the youth in the van that she
could smell something, and no one said anything. After they got
home, she reported the boys were sitting at the kitchen table
drinking their slushies and she could still smell the foul smell.
When Youth A came out of the shower, he was carrying a bag
which is where the smell was coming from, and Staff 1 knew that it
was his clothes that he soiled. Staff 1 reported Youth A has a
known issue where he has to wear a diaper because he will soil
himself at times and she reported has explained to him that it is
okay to have accidents, but he needs to not continue to sit in his
accident. Staff 1 reported when Youth A came out of his room to
get the rest of his toys, she pulled him aside to address the
situation. She reported she gave Youth A the direction that he
needed to throw the soiled items out and he does not get
extended tv time tonight due to not following his plan of sitting in
his soiled clothing. Staff 1 reported when she was speaking with
Youth A she was standing by the basement-level stairs that are
near the bedroom hallway. She reported Youth A got mad at her
about this and pushed himself into her to get to his room. Staff 1
reported Youth A shoved his right shoulder into the right side of
her body that was between the ledge and the stairway. This
caused Staff 1 to fall backwards. She reported when she was
falling backward, she pushed into Youth A by accident. She
reported Youth A just walked to his room after the incident. Staff 1
reported Staff 2 saw the incident occur and no other youth were
present. She reported Youth A apologized for shoving her later
that night. Staff 1 reported she never intentionally pushed Youth
A. She reported she never heard from Youth A or any other youth
that Administrator 1 told them they could not talk about an
incident. Staff 1 reported the youth talk to her about a lot of things,
so she does not believe that was true.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 27,
2023. Staff 2 reported she worked with Staff 1 on July 19, 2023.
She reported Staff 1 processed with Youth A after his shower that
night because he soiled himself and sat in it for a bit of time. Staff
2 reported after Youth A threw out the soiled items, he was upset
with Staff 1 and began to yell at her. She reported she saw Staff 1
standing by the basement stairway and the bedroom hallway.
3

Staff 2 reported she watched Youth A push through Staff 1 in
between the space of Staff 1 and the stairway instead of going
around her in the open space to get to the hallway. Staff 2
reported she watched as Youth A pushed through Staff 1 and then
Staff 1 fell backwards into the wall. She reported she did not see
Staff 1 ever put their hands on Youth A and after Youth A pushed
Staff 1, he went right to his bedroom. Staff 1 reported Youth A
eventually apologized to Staff 1. Staff 2 reported the facility has a
no-touch policy where staff are never to put their hands on a youth
and that they are trained to use verbal de-escalation. She reported
Staff 1 is a great staff and has never seen her put her hands on
any youth, including this incident with Youth A. Staff 1 reported
she has never heard from Youth A or any other youth that they
were told they could not talk about an incident with anyone.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
July 27, 2023. Administrator 1 reported he spoke with Youth A on
Thursday, July 20, 2023, due to the incident report completed by
Staff 1. He reported he asked Youth A why he pushed Staff 1 and
Youth A explained he was mad that Staff 1 addressed him about
soiling himself. Administrator 1 reported he was able to process
the situation with Youth A and noted Youth A was apologetic
about pushing Staff 1. He reported Youth A never stated Staff 1
pushed, shoved, or put her hands on him. Administrator 1
reported he never told Youth A he is not allowed to talk about this
situation to other adults. He reported he did talk to him about not
discussing the situation with other youth at the home because
they did not need to know about Youth A pushing Staff 1.
Administrator 1 reported he would never tell youth they could not
talk to other youth about other things. He reported he was not
present when the incident occurred, and the facility does not have
operating video cameras at the facility.
Therapist was interviewed via phone on July 27,
2023. Therapist reported she met with Youth A on July 26, 2023,
for his therapy session. She reported he seemed to be a bit off
and upset because he did not want to process why he was
grounded. Therapist reported Youth A told her he did something
bad, and Administrator 1 told him that he should not talk about it.
Youth A disclosed he was grounded because he pushed Staff 1
and noted that she shoved him back. Therapist reported Youth A
did not remember why he got upset at Staff 1 to shove her and did
not remember how Staff 1 shoved him back. Therapist reported
she planned to follow up with Administrator 1 today about the
situation.
4

Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 27,
2023. Youth B reported he has never seen a staff member push a
youth or ever put their hands on a youth. Youth B reported he
likes when Staff 1 works because she is nice and fair staff. He
reported whenever someone does something wrong at the facility,
typically Administrator 1 will come to debrief with the youth after
reading an incident report. Youth B reported Administrator 1 has
never told him that he cannot talk to someone about the incident
or lie about the incident. He reported Administrator 1 is a good
person and trusts him.
Youth A’s Foster Care Worker was interviewed via phone on
July 27, 2023. Youth A’s Foster Care Worker reported she has
had no concerns with the facility’s care of Youth A. She reported
Youth A does have a history of aggression and was asked to not
return to a prior facility due to his assaultive behavior toward a
staff member. Youth A’s Foster Care Worker reported she was not
aware of this situation occurring and noted there have been no
concerns about the facility’s reporting of incidents to her.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Incident Report dated 07/19/2023 completed by Staff 1-
This incident report was consistent with the interview completed with
Staff 1 and completed in a timely manner.
- Facility No Touch Policy dated 04/18/2020- Policy notes that staff
should not touch a youth at any time. Staff are to only use verbal de-
escalation techniques with an escalated youth and attempt to redirect
them. Staff should contact on call support when needed. It appears
that Staff 1 and Staff 2 followed the policy per the interviews
conducted.
- Human Resource File for Staff 1- There is no disciplinary actions
noted within Staff 1’s HR file. She completed all required trainings
noting her skill and technique training on 04/25/2023.
Analysis The facility is found to be in compliance with following the rule of
not pushing a youth. Within the interviews there was no evidence
found of Staff 1 intentionally shoved Youth A.
Consultation:
Consultation was provided to the facility regarding Youth B’s
transition plan as he is 19 years old. The facility is working with
the youth’s funding provider to make sure discharge planning is
occurring while looking into adult foster care programing.
Consultation was also provided to Administrator 1 regarding telling
Youth A not to talk to other youth about the situation.
Administrator 1 had good intentions, but it was discussed that a
5

youth should never be told they cannot talk to someone about an
incident as this could be misconstrued in the future which
happened within this case.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
